net.proteusframework.ui.miwt

Class Image

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.Image

  • public final class Image
extends Object

    Represents an image. Used in many components to enhance look and feel. The image is specified using an URI, URL or Resource. A URI is different from a URL in that a URI does not need to specify a resource location fully, i.e. it does not need a scheme, server, etc. A URL is an absolute reference.

    One of the greatest uses of a URL is to pull images from a JAR file using the Class.getResource() method. For example: if you call getClass(). getResource("images/x.png") the class loader will search for "x. png" in the class package name plus ".images". If it finds it anywhere in the classpath an appropriate URL will be returned.

    URIs that are not full specifications will be resolved depending on the medium implementation. For example, the HTML medium will take a relative URI as relative to the document root.

    If you specify a URL, both getURI() and getURL() will return non-null. If you specify a URI, getURL() may return null if the URI is not a valid URL.

    You may also use a Resource implementation to specify the image. This allows the image to be retrieved or created from any data source, for example a database. If a Resource object is used, both getURL() and getURI() will return null .

    This class is immutable and thread-safe.

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)
